</asker's comment>



<answer from>



26 weeks !Baby Boy#1
Member since: 22 September 2008
Total points: 2705 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



You need to be patient when your little one wants to come.



Here are some of the most common methods women try to induce labor naturally
Sexual intercourse - This works in two ways to induce labor. First, female orgasm can bring on contractions. Second, semen contains prostaglandins. Prostaglandins work to help ripe and soften the cervix.



Nipple stimulation - Stimulating the nipples triggers the production of natural oxytocin. Oxytocin contracts the uterus.



Accupressure - Accupressure may be helpful in inducing labor. Some pressure points you can try are the roof of your mouth, the webbing of your fingers between your pointer finger and thumb, and above the ankle about four fingerspaces above is a pressure point.



Stripping the membranes - This can only be done by a health care provider. Your doctor or midwife will seperate the bag of waters from your cervix and this is thought to help encourage labor to start.



Raspberry Leaf Tea - Rasberry leaf tea is not actually known for it's labor inducing properties, but it is believed to be helpful in toning the uterus and helping with labor.



Cinnamin stick tea - Take cinnamin sticks and boil them into a tea and drink. It actually tastes good so even if it doesn't bring on labor it may help you to relax.



Evening primrose oil - Evening primrose oil comes in small capsules similar to vitamin E. It is believed to help soften and ripen the cervix.



Walking - Walking may help to get baby to drop into proper position.



Visualization/relaxation - Relaxation can help with labor induction. Try doing relaxation exercisers. They are also good practice for when labor actually begins.



Pineapple, cumin tea, eggplant parmesan, and spicy foods - are another thing you can try.



Other methods we do not recommend for inducing labor
Castor oil - Castor oil is also used for inducing labor. It tastes horrible! It is likely to make you feel sick and it probably won't work.



Herbs - There are other herbs you can use to induce labor. Without consulting your doctor or midwife we do not recommend the use of herbs.



</answer>



<answer from>



Due in December
Member since: 29 July 2008
Total points: 1883 (Level 3)



</answer from>

Also, just know that your baby will come into the world when she's ready... you don't want to stress her or your body by pushing for things before the baby is ready.

<category>



Pregnancy & Parenting



Pregnancy



</category>



<question from>



sonu
Member since: 15 August 2008
Total points: 175 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Is ipill really effective?



If we are doing sex for 3-4 days conti. how many times should I eat it ?? I don't want to get pregnant and am ready to take any precaution.



No stupid answers plz....  and plz I am 23 and he is 27, we know what we are doing.



</question>



<answer from>



Harriet
Member since: 01 August 2008
Total points: 13781 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Men's Health



</answer from>



<answer>



OK if you know what you're doing and want to take any precaution you would know that the emergency contraceptive pill is not a good form of contraception especially not for days of continuous sex.



It should be taken once after normal contraception failed, not used as a method on its own and definitely not more than once. It is far less effective than using a condom any time or getting on the regular pill (about 85% compared to 99%).



I suggest you ask for a prescription for birth control pills (and make sure you have been on them long enough to be effective before you rely on them) and in the meantime use a condom every time you have sex.



Harriet



</answer>



<answer from>



Stella D
Member since: 30 October 2008
Total points: 119 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



what is ipill? If this is the emergency pill then you are not supposed to take it more than 3 times in one cycle or it just doesn't work effectively. If its the normal contraceptive pill then don't you just take one a day. Go to your doctor or family planning clinic to discuss contraception options.



</answer>



<answer from>



greathrt...
Member since: 25 February 2008
Total points: 592 (Level 2)

<answer>



Ipill is quite a good contraceptive pill but there are a lot of side effects ranging from nausea to uterus bleeding and abnormal periods....



</answer>

</answer from>



<answer>



Do not worry, there is still hope for the pregnancy.  They usually can't see much/anything until your levels are over 1000.  Just get another hCG in a few days, you should be able to see your bean on a transvaginal ultrasound by then too.  Good luck!



</answer>

<answer>



Yes it is normal, regardless of your size. However, it may be bloating. Also, no one else likely notices, unless you are slim. But slim or curvy, it is normal, as everyone is different and some show earlier than others.
I panicked when I started showing at 10 weeks as I am curvy and everyone says that only slim people show early. I thought I was carrying twins or something. But I am not.
Other than me and my husband, no one could tell that my stomach had grown. Others will start noticing around 20 weeks.



</answer>



<answer from>



Stella D
Member since: 30 October 2008
Total points: 119 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>

Remember every pregnancy is different and whats normal for you won't be the same for another. If your really slim you might just be noticing your belly getting bigger earlier because you don't have much fat around your stomach normally.

<answer>



Yes, I like the potluck idea. You don't have to put on a show-stopping holiday event. Christmas is about family being together, not hosting the perfect party.  Just do whatever you can to make it easy on yourself - many grocery stores and restaurants make holiday meals for pick-up, or you could do something out of the norm and funky, like have a Chinese take-out feast. It's all about having some family time, not how the table is set or cooking a lot of fancy dishes. If you explain all this to your husband perhaps he'll help come up with some ways to be able to have everyone over without stressing you out.  Being nine months pregnant with a toddler is a totally understandable condition, no one would fault you for having a "low-key" dinner this year.

<question>



Is it possible to be pregnant even if you don't experience any symptom for 3 months?

<answer from>

Member since: 29 August 2008

Contributing In:

</answer from>



<answer>

<answer from>



kaylaxki...
Member since: 11 August 2008
Total points: 3575 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



first off, you cannot have sex without penetration, that is what sex is...do you mean, you had sex without ejaculation? because there is sperm in pre-ejaculate, which def. can get you pregnant. you dont need to have sypmtoms to be pregnant, either...alot women dont realize they are pregnant for this reason...if you are late and concerned about being pregnant, you need to take a pregnancy test. if it comes out negative and still no period, then you need to goto the doctor to find out what is going on. it is possible you are stressing yourself out, making yourself late, which is really easy to do to yourself.



good luck



</answer>

Use a home pregnancy test.  There is no other way to know.  Many of the signs of PMS are confused with those of early pregnancy and of course it is different for everyone.  Take a test



Good luck



</answer>



<answer from>



Harriet
Member since: 01 August 2008
Total points: 13787 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Men's Health



</answer from>



<answer>



Yes you could be



Harriet



</answer>

<question from>



Jenny S
Member since: 05 August 2007
Total points: 521 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



If a man has mrsa and his wife gets pregnant will the mrsa be present in the baby?



Will the mrsa virus develop in the baby if the father is infected with it while the mother conceives



</question>



<answer from>



Starry Eyes
Member since: 19 July 2008
Total points: 4199 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



i think unless it's genetic he'd have to give it to the mother for the baby to get infected.  Definately something worth asking a dr though.



</answer>



<answer from>



Míss Pσsítívítч ♀
Member since: 19 February 2008
Total points: 12474 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Trying to Conceive



</answer from>



<answer>



It's really down to the woman carrying the baby, from what I understand.



When a pregnant woman is a carrier of MRSA bacteria without an infection, there is no risk to her unborn baby at all.



If a pregnant woman becomes infected with MRSA, as with all infections, there is a very small chance that it could pass to the unborn baby. However, this is extremely rare.



Source(s):



http://www.nhsdirect.nhs.uk/articles/art...



</answer>



<answer from>



krismas_...
Member since: 12 May 2008
Total points: 396 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



im pretty positive that is a no because it his sperm shouldn't have it you only contract marsa in certain locations and i have never heard of testicular marsa but definitely ask a dr.



Source(s):



nursing assistant 3 yrs



</answer>



<answer from>



Paris Rose
Member since: 12 September 2008
Total points: 1033 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



MRSA (Methecillin Resistant Staphylococcus Aureus) is a bacteria, not a virus, so no It will not transfer to your unborn baby, but if your partner still carries the bacteria, he will possibly infect the newborn after birth.



If he is going to be present at the birth, the medical staff will need to know to protect the staff and other babies on the ward.



It would also be advisable to be tested to see if you also are a carrier.



Good luck!



</answer>



<answer from>



kaylaxki...
Member since: 11 August 2008
Total points: 3581 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



no

Brenda A

Total points: 622 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Before implanting the first woman's eggs into the second woman, they have to be furtilized by a male's sperm. Then, once incubation has begun, it is then implanted into the second woman. The second woman's eggs are never used for the procedure.... Just her uterus to carry the baby.



Think of it this way... I mix bread dough in my kitchen (with ALL the ingredients) and then take it to my neighbor's house to put it in the oven.



As far as your question about two women (lesbians), this may be what some of them could do to make both women feel closer to their child, but only one would be related via DNA, and the other would be the one to carry the child to term... using a 3rd person (male) for the sperm.



Hope that made it a little clearer.



</answer>

<question>



I had the depo shot, then had sex... very concerned.....Ill pick a BEST ANSWER.?



Ok so last tuesday I had my first depo shot. I had sex on saturday morning, saturday night, and on sunday with my bf. He didnt c*m inside me, (yes I know its still a huge risk.) We would have sex then put a condom on for a while before he came.



So Im wondering when I should expect to bleed next. In a month? A week? I just want to be sure I am not prego now. The doc told me to wait a week to be on the Safe Side...I pretty much waited about 4-5 days.



Oh and I got the shot the 2nd to last day of my period.



</question>

<answer from>



missyboo...
Member since: 24 June 2006
Total points: 1676 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Your cycle is going to be so unpredictable now that you got the shot.  Some women never get a period, some bleed every day for weeks or months on end.  Others get surprised when they get random bleeding for a few days.  You will not have regular periods.  You can get pregnant in the early part of getting the depo shot (like your doctor said, the first week or so).  The only thing you really can do is wait and test when you should technically be getting your period, or maybe even wait a few weeks later than that.



My friend did that very thing you described, and she ended up pregnant, and didn't even know because her doctor said she would have very irregular periods.  She didn't suspect anything until she had gained quite a bit of weight and she was 5 months pregnant!



</answer>
